DOC.detailed_description: Background Multiple clinical study indicate obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) , common chronic sleep disorder , may affect neurocognitive function , treatment continuous positive airway pressure ( CPAP ) neurocognitive protective effect adverse effect OSA . However , effect CPAP treatment neurocognitive architecture function remain unclear . Therefore , multicenter trial design investigate whether neurocognitive architecture function patient OSA improve CPAP treatment , explore role gut microbiota improve neurocognitive function treatment . Methods/Design This study multicenter , randomize , control trial allocation concealment assessor blinding . A total 148 eligible patient severe OSA enrol five sleep center , randomize receive CPAP best supportive care ( BSC ) intervention BSC intervention alone . Cognitive function , structure function brain region , gut microbiota , metabolite , biochemical variable , electrocardiography , echocardiography , pulmonary function , arterial stiffness assess baseline randomization 3 , 6 , 12 month . In addition , investigator enroll 74 healthy control assess aforementioned variable baseline . Ethics Dissemination Ethics approval give Medical Ethics Committee Shanghai Jiao Tong University Affiliated Sixth People 's Hospital ( approval number 2015-79 ) . The finding study disseminate peer-reviewed journal conference .
